12.author: Ben P
text: Why is the judge upholding the judgement of his predecessor (and current nemisis) when this is explicitly not mandated in rule 214?

11.author: Chris B
text: Can we interpret any completed vote on a new rule as adopted.

10.author: Dave M
text: If Rule 204 is void (as per most recent judgement), by what mechanism may rule changes be adopted?

4.author: Ben P
text: Is typing I agree/disagree only valid in the context of to a pre-existing dispute?

6.author: Chris B
text: Points of order against a judge must be judged my an independent judge

13.author: Dave M
text: In rule 203, does "number of the highest numbered existing rule" include the number of a new rule enacted by said vote?

7.author: Chris B
text: Sending judgments twice constitutes editing making all judgments void

1.author: Dave M
text: In the event that a mutable rule conflicts with an immutable rule only in part, does that part of rule 112 which states "the mutable rule shall be entirely void" pertain to the mutable rule as a whole, or only to that part in conflict with the immutable rule?

5.author: Chris B
text: Judge must have obtained a PhD at the time of making judgment otherwise all judgments are void

0.author: Dave M
text: May a new mutable rule supersede an immutable rule, without first transmuting said immutable rule?

15.author: Chris B
text: Can one use amend rule to completely change a rule. Does this not count as repealing.

16.author: Ben P
text: Given that Proposition 308 does not seem to be a valid amendment according to the linked judgement, has a valid rule-change been made this day? In particular, may the proposal still be adopted and points modified as a consequence of the vote?

2.author: Alex T
text: Can rules be "in conflict" (Rule  only at the point of use? Or are rules in conflict if there is a situation where they will come to contradict each other over the course of play. Furthermore, if I adjust my play due to the presence of certain rules that may come to contradict each other, have they already come "into conflict" given that they have both influenced my play over said issue?

14.author: Ben P
text: Would players receive points due to Rule 205 who vote against a successful proposal to repeal Rule 205?

8.author: Alex W
text: Rule 204 is invalid. A transmutation is a rule change as stipulated in 103 and 111 , 111 says rule changes which are transmutations are adopted by unanimous vote. Rule 204 says rule changes are adopted by unanimous vote currently but after the second circuit of turns changes to simple majority. This has effected my method of play. Therefore by judges decision yesterday these are in conflict. By judges decision yesterday 204 is 'entirely void'.

3.author: Chris B
text: Judge was not a sound mind when making judgement rendering his judgements void
